result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephan M Strawder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive, with credit for 4 DAYS time served.

miscConds.notes:
- Fine of $600.00 plus costs, fees and assessments.
- Court set restitution at zero.
- Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.
- All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by 10/12/2023 to convert to a civil judgment.
- The Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

- No driving without a valid drivers license or proof of insurance.
- No entry to a premise serving fermented malt beverages or intoxicating liquors for the first 2 years of supervision.

- AODA assessment.
- Absolute sobriety with random testing.

timeConds.notes: With Huber for work and treatment. Defense to provide a detailed outline as to defendant's work and treatment schedule.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephan M Strawder

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Stephan M Strawder in court.  Attorney Craig Michael Kuhary in court for Stephan M Strawder.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin.
CASE HEARD IN BRANCH 37 FOR BRANCH 19. 
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
As to Count 1:
Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Jury instructions are written in the plea documents.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his/her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights are restored.
*
Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 48 MONTHS, with credit for  4 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 24 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS, consecutive.
The defendant  is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS ELIGIBLE for the Substance Abuse Program.  
The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 36 MONTHS with the following conditions:

Conditions of probation are:
- 12 months condition in the HOC with huber for work and treatment. Defense to provide a detailed outline as to defendant's work and treatment schedule.
- absolute sobriety with random testing
- no driving without a valid drivers license or proof of insurance
- no entry to a premise serving fermented malt beverages or intoxicating liquors for the first 2 years of supervision
Court further ordered:
- Fine of $600.00 plus costs, fees and assessments
- 24 months drivers license revocation.
- 24 months ignition interlock.
- AODA assessment.

Court set restitution at zero.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.

All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by 10/12/2023 to convert to a civil judgment. 

The Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Appellate rights given to defendant.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, received and filed.

ADJOURNED OFF THE RECORD VIA EMAIL.
Case calendared for a Plea and Sentencing Hearing.
Court is in trial on a different matter and ordered case adjourned.
Parties notified via email and new date selected. 
This hearing will be held in person before Branch 37 for Branch 19.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed: Treatment verification, certificate of completion & character letters

Received and Filed: 
letter from West Grove Clinic and Certificate of Completion from West Grove Clinic

Defendant Stephan M Strawder in court with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.  Wiliam Ackell for Samuel Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense  request a resolution date. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. Parties advised this hearing will be held in person, Room 313 of the Safety Building.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Stephan M Strawder in court with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.  William R. F. Ackell appeared on behalf of Samuel E. Simpson for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received Discovery and Offer letter and requested scheduling conference. Case adjourned in Branch 45.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Wagner.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Kies, Br. 45.

Defendant Stephan M Strawder in court with Attorney Craig Michael Kuhary; both appear by video.  Ian Vance Curzan appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 046601,
Payable Number: 1006000,
Receipt Number: 22RP019154,
Amount: $20.00
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No driving without a valid license.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Stephan M Strawder in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Stephan M Strawder in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stephan M Strawder appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
